title: Joshua bides time, batters Paul in sixth-round KO
content: It took longer than many predicted, but Anthony Joshua finally hunted down Jake Paul, dropping him four times in a sixth-round knockout victory.

title: Sources: Dillingham signs 5-year deal with ASU
content: Arizona State coach Kenny Dillingham has signed a new five-year contract that will average nearly $7.5 million over the course of the deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Sooners' errors key big blown lead, loss to Bama
content: A month after miscues by Alabama fueled the defining win of Oklahoma's season, the Tide flipped the script, feasting on errors by Sooners QB John Mateer and OU's special teams to overcome a 17-point deficit in a 34-24 win in the CFP's first round.

title: Sources: Rockets expand talks to buy, move Sun
content: Rockets ownership is in substantive talks with the Connecticut Sun over the potential purchase and relocation of the WNBA franchise to Houston, sources told ESPN.

title: Griffin, Parker, Pearl among new HOF candidates
content: Blake Griffin, Candace Parker, Jamal Crawford, the 1996 U.S. Olympic women's basketball team, Bruce Pearl and Kelvin Sampson are among the first-time nominees for the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: Kobe-MJ Logoman card fetches $3.17M at auction
content: A 2003 Upper Deck Exquisite Collection dual Logoman card of Kobe Bryant and Michael Jordan sold via Heritage Auctions for $3,172,000, the seventh-most expensive basketball card sale.

title: Kraken trade Marchment to CBJ after 29 games
content: The Seattle Kraken have traded forward Mason Marchment to the Columbus Blue Jackets for two draft picks.

title: üèà 2026 NFL draft: Five-team race for No. 1 pick
content: The Raiders, Browns, Titans, Giants and Jets are front-runners for the No. 1 pick. What would they do with the top selection?

title: Last-minute prep on NFL Week 16: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Fantasy upside for J.J. McCarthy and Tyler Shough? An advantage for the Bears' rushing attack? Upset brewing in Commanders-Eagles? Let's look at Week 16.

title: An Ivy Leaguer in Aggieland: Can Mike Elko make Texas A&M believe?
content: The Aggies head into their first College Football Playoff appearance looking to banish the program's ghosts.

title: 'No fear of failure': Miami's Malachi Toney is ready for prime time
content: The freshman receiver, who should be in his final year of high school, has instead been a highlight machine.

title: College Football Playoff 2025: Quarterfinal first look
content: Here's how each team can win its quarterfinal game, plus key players, X factors and what we learned from the first round.

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the College Football Playoff
content: Four campuses across the country were abuzz over the weekend as the College Football Playoff came to town.

title: NBA MVP straw poll: 14 players received votes -- two lead the way
content: SGA? Jokic? Cup MVP Jalen Brunson? We polled 100 media members in a ballot that mirrors the league's official vote.

title: How different is Pete Golding from Lane Kiffin? Start with social media and yoga
content: After weeks of speculation and turmoil, the Rebels and their new coach are eager to get back on the field.

title: 'That's going to probably piss off some pitchers': How MLB teams are approaching new ball-strike challenge system
content: The strategic side of baseball's next big rule change is already in motion. Here's the early thinking from MLB managers.

content: Which of the five basketball power conferences is more likely to produce this season's national champion?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

title: How Bears DC Dennis Allen has created a takeaway machine
content: The Bears lead the NFL in takeaways differential (plus-20), interceptions (21) and total takeaways (30). Here's why.

title: Did you know there are 13 active former No. 1 picks in the NFL? We examine them all
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett are having the best seasons of all 13 of the former No. 1 picks currently in the NFL.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Mbapp√©'s quest to overtake Ronaldo, Spurs-Liverpool, more
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? For starters, Kylian Mbapp√©'s quest to make Madrid history, plus the Africa Cup of Nations kicks off.

title: Week 16 betting guide: Backing Maye to throw Patriots to a W, Achane to run wild
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

title: Heading into her final Olympics, Hilary Knight's impact is as big as ever
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

title: The tag team title match leaves something to be desired
content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Why did Hamilton's debut season at Ferrari go sideways? Will it get any better in 2026?
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari was supposed to be a dream come true, but it became a nightmare. Will 2026's regulation change make things right?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Man City defender Gvardiol
content: Manchester City defender Josko Gvardiol is a target for Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Risers and fallers: Add Dylan Harper, Cam Spencer for instant offense
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: India T20 World Cup squad: Why Shubman Gill was dropped - at the last moment
content: Shubman Gill's omission from India T20I World Cup squad has come as a surprise to many. The decision to drop the vice-captain from the squad was taken only a few days back and it suits everyone. Captain SKY doesn't have a high-profile player breathing down his neck, coach Gambhir will not be accused of favouritism and chief selector Ajit Agarkar has managed to reward a domestic performer.

title: 'Deshdrohis trying to protect infiltrators': PM Modi defends SIR at Assam rally
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday criticized the previous Congress government for neglecting Assam and the Northeast's development. He said Modi government is rectifying past mistakes and is committed to the region's progress.

title: T20 WC squad: 'Very happy' Ishan Kishan reacts to India recall as Gill misses out
content: Ishan Kishan expressed his delight after being selected for India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad, returning to the national side following a stellar Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy campaign. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the 15-member team, with Shubman Gill notably excluded due to form and fitness concerns.

title: BMC polls: Congress decides to go solo; Uddhav‚ÄìRaj bonhomie strains MVA
content: The Congress party has announced it will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections independently. This decision comes as Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's MNS appear to be aligning, potentially to protect the Thackeray political legacy. The MVA alliance, which includes Congress, faced a significant defeat in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

title: ‚ÄòYou are wrong‚Äô: Former ASML engineer build EUV machine; contradicts CEO‚Äôs timeline
content: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

title: T20 World Cup | Jitesh Sharma: A team man left behind by SKY, Gambhir and Agarkar
content: Despite doing everything asked of him, Jitesh Sharma has paid the price for India‚Äôs muddled selection calls. In the World Cup Playing XI plans a few days ago, the 32-year-old finisher was quietly dropped at the last moment, exposing a deeper lack of clarity in the team‚Äôs thinking and leaving a team man heartbroken.

title: Social media ban: Can India mirror Aus model? Promise, pitfalls, and practicality
content: Australia has enacted a law prohibiting social media use for those under 16, a move sparking global debate. While parents largely support it, youth oppose it. India faces similar discussions, with challenges in implementing a ban due to its vast population and digital integration.

title: 'Attack on interests of poor': Sonia Gandhi slams PM Modi over VB-G RAM G Bill
content: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government. She claims the new VB-G RAM G Bill replaces MGNREGA and harms the poor. The government states the new law improves upon MGNREGA, which it says was plagued by corruption. The opposition protested the bill's passage in Parliament.

title: Google reverses AI talent drain: Engineers return in big numbers; ‚ÄòBig‚Äô reason why
content: Google is successfully luring back top AI talent with its robust computational infrastructure, including TPUs and cloud services, rather than solely relying on massive signing bonuses. This 'boomerang' strategy is proving effective, with former employees making up a significant portion of new AI hires, highlighting the value engineers place on the ability to build groundbreaking products.

title: German couple detained for 'illegal religious conversions' near India-Pakistan border
content: Six individuals, including a German couple, were detained in Sriganganagar for alleged illegal religious conversions. The group was found in a rented house in Srikaranpur, a town near the India-Pakistan border. Authorities are investigating the German nationals' presence in a restricted border zone without authorization.

title: Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee is reportedly unhappy with his Boss - What he said
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Why Shubman Gill missed out on T20 World Cup 2026 selection: Ajit Agarkar breaks silence
content: Shubman Gill has been excluded from India's T20 World Cup squad due to his recent lack of form. Axar Patel has been appointed vice-captain, while Ishan Kishan returns as the second wicketkeeper and reserve opener. Rinku Singh is back as the designated finisher.

title: UP shocker: Teen boy ‚Äòslammed on floor‚Äô by hospital staff after kin refuse to pay bribe
content: A 14-day-old infant's body was exhumed in Pilibhit following allegations of deliberate harm by hospital staff over an unpaid bribe. Parents claim the child was dropped, while hospital officials deny this, stating a vacuum extraction led to swelling mistaken for injury. The father alleges threats after reporting the incident, prompting a magistrate-ordered autopsy for clarity.

title: Xavier Worthy car collection: Inside Chiefs WR‚Äôs $1M-plus luxury garage
content: Kansas City Chiefs star Xavier Worthy's luxury car collection, reportedly valued over $1 million, includes a Rolls-Royce Phantom, Dodge Charger, Mercedes SUV, and a Bugatti. This comes after his expensive car was stolen from a downtown garage in May 2024. Worthy recently unveiled a custom-built garage showcasing his football journey.

title: Sivakarthikeyan moves Madras high court over Rs 15 cr payment dispute
content: Actor Sivakarthikeyan has found himself in a legal battle with Studio Green Films, as he files a case in the Madras High Court for Rs 15 crore in outstanding payments for the film 'Mr. Local'.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: T20 World Cup squad: Captain Suryakumar speaks up on his form; remarks after Gill's omission
content: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, selectors dropped Shubman Gill, prioritizing impact players and quick starts. Ishan Kishan and Rinku Singh return, while captain Suryakumar Yadav, despite recent lean form, expressed confidence in his batting resurgence. The team aims for stronger performances from its leader as they prepare to defend their title.

title: 'Mistaken for Bangladeshi national': Dalit man beaten to death in Kerala; probe under way
content: A Dalit migrant worker from Chhattisgarh, Ramnarayan Baghel, was tragically beaten to death in Kerala's Palakkad district. Initial reports suggest he was mistaken for a Bangladeshi national and possibly a thief after a local incident. Five arrests have been made as police investigate the brutal mob violence that has left his family devastated and sparked fear among migrant communities.

title: Guwahati airport gets new terminal: PM Modi inaugurates the project - see stunning pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Guwahati's new nature-themed airport terminal, designed with local bamboo and inspired by Assam's biodiversity.

title: Chat cart: When your tandoori naan & tikka aren‚Äôt smoky, but everything else is
content: Winters in Delhi once meant a sensory delight of seasonal foods, from makke ki roti to halwa. However, recent years have brought deadly pollution, replacing aromatic food whiffs with the smell of burning and health concerns. Despite this, foodies still brave the smog to savor traditional street food, though conversations now revolve around pollution and sore throats.

title: Jharkhand horror: Drunk army jawan 'rapes' woman inside train; accused arrested
content: An Army jawan on duty was arrested in Ranchi for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman at Tatisilwai Railway Station. The 42-year-old soldier, reportedly inebriated, took the woman to an empty train coach and committed the assault. He was apprehended after bystanders raised an alarm.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 16: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer eyes Rs 500 cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, entering its third week with over Rs. 480 crore. The spy thriller is projected to surpass Rs. 500 crore by Saturday, even amidst competition from 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'. The film has shown impressive growth since its massive opening, based on true incidents.

title: 'Who will bring murderers to justice?' B'desh author says mob pounced on Hindu man 'like hyenas'
content: A Hindu garment worker named Dipu Chandra Das was brutally killed by a mob in Bangladesh. He was accused of blasphemy. The incident occurred in Bhaluka, Mymensingh. Authorities have arrested seven individuals in connection with the lynching. This event has raised serious concerns about the safety of religious minorities in the country.

title: Augusta Westland deal: Christian Michel released in PMLA case; remains in CBI custody
content: A Delhi court on Saturday ordered the release of Christian Michel James from custody in the Augusta Westland money laundering case, as he has served the maximum statutory sentence. While released from the PMLA case, Michel will remain in custody for the related CBI case.

title: Choking saga! To escape toxic air, Delhiites clog Manali town; 15,000 vehicles in 15 days
content: Manali is experiencing severe traffic jams as thousands of tourists, many from Delhi, flock to the region for Christmas and New Year. Daily vehicle influx exceeds 1,000, causing significant congestion on key routes. Authorities are prioritizing traffic management with increased police deployment and a planned traffic strategy.

title: Court will always lean towards animals who suffer silently: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has signaled its strong inclination to protect elephants, stating it will always favor animals whose migration paths are obstructed by commercial tourism. This stance emerged during hearings concerning wildlife resorts in Tamil Nadu's Sigur Plateau elephant corridor. The court emphasized that any doubt regarding benefit should go to the silent victims of development.

title: Quote of the day by Sigmund Freud: 'A man should not strive to eliminate‚Ä¶'
content: Famous Austrian neurologist Sigmund Freud completely changed the way we look at the human mind by discovering psychoanalysis. It was a talking therapy for mental issues rooted in unconscious thoughts which people fail to realize and accept.  His  famous book "Interpretation of Dreams" said that dreams reveal hidden desires of human beings.

title: 'Rs 30 lakh to take image with Messi‚Äô: Kolkata police raid organiser Satadru Dutta‚Äôs house
content: Authorities investigating the Lionel Messi event's mismanagement raided chief organizer Satadru Dutta's home, uncovering a lavish residence with a pool and soccer ground. The probe has broadened beyond crowd control to suspected Rs 100 crore financial irregularities, including unaccounted cash for photos with Messi and opaque ticket sales, suggesting deliberate financial impropriety.

title: General degree vs. Honours degree: What matters more in today's job market?
content: Indian students often favour honours degrees, but the job market is shifting. Employers now prioritize practical skills, internships, and problem-solving over degree labels. While honours degrees offer depth for academic or specialized careers, general degrees provide flexibility. Ultimately, preparedness and demonstrable abilities, not just the degree title, determine employability in today's economy.

title: Epstein files opened: From steamy photos to call logs ‚Äî What's in them and what is still missing
content: The Department of Justice released thousands of files related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, but a substantial portion remains unpublished. Congress had set a December 19 deadline for the release, and while some documents are now accessible, many are heavily redacted or previously public, drawing criticism from lawmakers.

title: Gurgaon horror: Auto driver kidnaps two minor girls, rapes child; assailant jumps off flyover
content: An auto driver kidnapped two minor sisters, sexually assaulting the elder one in Manesar. A passerby alerted police, leading to a chase. The accused jumped from a flyover, sustaining leg fractures, and was apprehended. He faces charges under the POCSO Act.

title: World Bank funding boost for Pakistan: $700m tranche approved under multi-phase plan
content: The World Bank has approved $700 million in fresh financing for Pakistan to bolster macroeconomic stability and enhance public service delivery. This funding, part of a larger $1.35 billion program, will support federal initiatives and a provincial project in Sindh, signaling continued multilateral support despite governance concerns.

title: 'It's not about form': Surya reveals real reason for Gill's omission from T20 World Cup squad
content: Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup squad exclusion sparks debate, with captain Suryakumar Yadav citing team combination and the need for a top-order keeper.  The decision prioritizes balance over individual form, impacting other batting selections as India aims to retain their title.

title: From Eisenhower to Trump: How US presidents shaped the Kennedy Center
content: The Kennedy Center has unveiled new signage, officially renaming it The Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts following a unanimous board vote. This change comes amidst an investigation into the center's leadership over allegations of cronyism and corruption.

title: Lab assistant dies after 'snakebite'; sons plotted murder for Rs 3-cr insurance
content: A chilling murder plot unfolded in Tiruvallur district where two sons allegedly orchestrated their father's death by snakebite to claim ‚Çπ3 crore in insurance.  Initially ruled accidental, the investigation revealed a staged second bite by a krait after a previous cobra incident. Six individuals, including the sons, have been arrested.

title: Infosys stock shock! Why did ADRs jump nearly 40% in minutes on NYSE? Explained
content: US-listed Infosys shares surged nearly 40% in minutes, briefly adding billions to its market value and triggering a NYSE trading halt due to extreme volatility.  The rapid, unexplained rally, occurring during low liquidity, is being attributed to a potential short squeeze or a data error mislabeling the ticker.

title: 'Lenient' punishment: Former Pak PM Imran, wife Bibi sentenced to 17 yrs in prison
content: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi have been sentenced to 17 years in prison each in the Toshakhana corruption case. The verdict, delivered by an accountability court, pertains to alleged fraud involving state gifts received from the Saudi government in 2021. Both were fined Rs 10 million.

title: Hindu man lynched, body burnt in Bangladesh; 7 arrested
content: Seven arrests were made after a Hindu youth was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. The victim, Dipu Chandra Das, was accused of making derogatory comments. This incident follows the recent killing of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, sparking renewed unrest and political instability.

title: 'Lane is for staff, are you anpadh': Argument at Delhi airport escalates into physical assault
content: An Air India Express pilot has been grounded after allegedly assaulting a passenger at Delhi Airport's Terminal 1. The altercation began when the pilot questioned a passenger using a staff lane, escalating into a physical confrontation. The passenger claims he was left with a bloodied face and his daughter traumatized. An inquiry is underway.

title: 'I feel distracted when kids play on road': Ex-gym trainer assaults multiple children in Bengaluru
content: A former gym trainer, Ranjan M, has been accused by parents in Thyagarajanagar of targeting several children with bike incidents and physical assaults. The most serious case involved a five-year-old boy who was kicked while playing. Police confirm Ranjan appears mentally unstable and is undergoing treatment, having confessed to the assaults due to agitation from children playing.

title: 'Serious violation': Pakistan hockey team manager caught smoking on aircraft; barred from flight
content: Pakistan hockey Olympian Anjum Saeed faces controversy. He was reportedly caught smoking on a plane in Rio de Janeiro. This led to him and a player being offloaded. Saeed claims personal work in Dubai. Officials dispute this. The Pakistan Sports Board has ordered an inquiry. The incident reflects poorly on Pakistan sport.

title: Earlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation: Neeraj Ghaywan
content: ‚ÄúEarlier, untouchability was a thing to shame people; now it is reservation quota. It feels like reservation is a privilege that has been accorded- It is not a poverty alleviation programme. It is a reparation for a 2,000-year-old injustice,‚Äù says Neeraj Ghaywan at The Hindu Mind

title: Gen Z and the fading Christmas, New Year card tradition
content: Vendors selling Christmas cards in Kozhikode are no longer able to drive sales as they once did, as a significant shift in gifting habits has occurred due to the generational gap

title: Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan talks tough against those issuing threats to contractors, bureaucrats in Andhra Pradesh
content: Referring to YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy‚Äôs threat that those partnering with the government to run medical colleges in the PPP mode will be sent to jail if he is voted to power, the Deputy Chief Minister warns of adopting zero tolerance approach, similar to the one being followed by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath towards scriminals

title: Researchers at Cusat granted patent for advanced digital evidence fingerprinting system
content: The system reportedly strengthens conventional digital evidence hashing techniques by integrating multiple security parameters

title: Madras High Court amici curiae to inspect site for proposed 184-feet-tall Lord Murugan statue at Marudhamalai
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy ask the amici curiae to submit their inspection report by January 23

title: Leadership issue: High command will call us at an appropriate time: Shivakumar
content: Congress workers will not allow Gandhi‚Äôs India to be turned into Godse‚Äôs India, he says at protest rally in Bengaluru

title: Karnataka tops FASTag penalty collections in 2024‚Äì25
content: The State has collected ‚Çπ129.91 crore from motorists who either did not use FASTag or whose tags were invalid or non-functional at toll plazas

title: Three indigenous duck varities stage a return to Kuttanad wetlands
content: The Vigova, Kuttanadan Chembally, and Snow White varieties make a comeback after last year‚Äôs bird flu outbreak. The Duck Hatchery and Training Institute in Manjadi is supplying nearly 2,000 one-day-old ducklings weekly to farmers across Kerala.

title: Munnar records -1¬∞C, tourism sector eyes big push
content: Temperatures touch 0¬∞ C in Chenduvarai, Silent Valley, Letchmi, Devikulam and at Nallathanni on Saturday morning

title: Public urged to make cleanliness a part of lifestyle
content: Maintaining hygiene in villages, towns, schools, and public spaces is essential in building a healthy society, says Collector

title: Indigenously built stroke device¬†approved on¬†domestic¬†trial data,¬†launch set for February 2026
content: The device is used to treat severe strokes by removing clots and restoring blood flow to the brain within 24 hours

title: T.N. to survey hornbill population for long-term conservation
content: Timed to coincide with the birds‚Äô breeding season, the effort is part of the State‚Äôs initiative for hornbill conservation announced earlier this year

title: Watch: K. Kavitha on contesting polls and the welfare vs development debate | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, K. Kavitha discusses her plans to contest the upcoming elections and reflects on the thin line between welfare politics and development.

title: Chandrababu Naidu launches ‚ÄòMustabu‚Äô, counsels schoolstudents to maintain personal hygiene
content: He advises students to follow basic habits such as washing face regularly, keeping nails clean, wearing neat uniform and shoes, combing hair properly, and dressing in a proper manner; he also exhorts them to set clear goals in life, dream big, work hard, and strive to reach greater heights

title: 60 FIRs for child pornography registered in 2025 based on 1,197 leads from Delhi Police special unit
content: This marks a nearly 56% decline compared to 2024, when 136 FIRs were registered based on 1,809 leads forwarded to district units, the data suggests

title: Election campaign materials litter Kochi despite government circular, High Court directive
content: Circular issued by Local Self-Government dept. stated that if candidates/parties failed to comply, local body secretaries should remove the materials and cost collected from candidates

title: Healthcare in Tamil Nadu: where less meets more
content: More people are walking into government hospitals in Tamil Nadu than ever before. But the health workforce has not kept pace with the rising patient numbers. Despite the State‚Äôs significant investment in health infrastructure, manpower shortages remain unaddressed, and certain policy missteps are proving expensive, say doctors and nurses

title: NCVET recognises A.P. Board of Intermediate Education as awarding body
content: This milestone enables nationally recognised certification of vocational skills, beginning with approved Sericulture Technician qualification, says Nara Lokesh

title: Himachal orders drug recall after 47 samples fail quality tests
content: ‚ÄúOut of 200 medicine samples tested nationwide, 47 were manufactured in the State. These include medications for fever, heart attacks, and diabetes. Notices have been issued to the respective companies,‚Äù says Himachal Pradesh State Drug Controller

title: Mamata wants to incite Hindu-Muslim riots: BJP
content: Gaurav Bhatia claimed that the Mamata Banerjee's appeasement politics for votes have been evident from her past comments and actions

title: Bhopal metro inaugurated, Orange Line services to begin on December 21
content: India to soon leave U.S. behind in Metro rail network length, Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said

title: Human-elephant conflict in Chittoor district shows sign of abatement
content: Conflict management took a revolutionary turn in 2025 with the deployment of trained kumki elephants in the district, where the number of human casualties stood at nine during 2024-25

title: Union Minister inaugurates Gen Z Post Office in Amaravati
content: Having transformed into an e-commerce platform, Postal Department is no longer confined to the delivery of letters, says Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar

title: CPI(M) slams fundamentalists over unrest in Bangladesh
content: The party termed the attack on two most revered cultural institutions in the border country, Chhayanot and Udichi, "dastardly‚Äù

title: KBF‚Äôs ‚ÄôArt by Children‚Äô initiative cultivating environment for art and creativity
content: Through ABC, the Kochi Biennale Foundation has been working to uplift communities including children, parents and art educators

title: Jharkhand Minister offers job, flat to Bihar doctor after hijab row
content: "I have invited the woman doctor to Jharkhand and offered her a job with a ‚Çπ3 lakh monthly salary, a flat, a desired posting, and full security," says Jharkhand Health Minister

title: Bombay team revisits Bekal to mark 30 years of the classic
content: Director Mani Ratnam, Manisha Koirala and cinematographer Rajiv Menon arrived at Bekal Fort on Saturday morning to mark 30 years of the 1995 film Bombay

title: PM Modi's speech at Bengal rally lacks concerns about Matuas' citizenship, alleges TMC
content: PM Modi urged the people to provide a chance to the BJP in the 2026 Assembly polls to form a ‚Äúdouble-engine government‚Äù in the State

title: Tourism Minister releases book on fairs and festivals of Tamil Nadu
content: The coffee-table book titled Fairs and Festivals: Traditional and Ancient Customs of Tamil Nadu is jointly produced by The Hindu Group and the Tourism department

title: On way to PM's rally, 3 mowed down by train in West Bengal amid dense fog
content: The incident occurred between Taherpur and Badkulla railway stations under the Sealdah-Krishnanagar section of Eastern Railway

title: Modi Government bulldozed MGNREGA, says Sonia Gandhi, vows fight against 'black law'
content: ‚ÄúBy weakening MGNREGA, the Modi Government had attacked the interests of millions of farmers, labourers, and landless people,‚Äù says Sonia Gandhi

title: BJP again attacks Rahul Gandhi alleging Soros link, claims he met 'enemies of India' in Germany
content: Spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia showed a purported picture of Rahul Gandhi with Berlin-based Hertie school professor Cornellia Woll and called it "proof" of him meeting "anti-India forces in Germany"

title: Christian Michel James gets bail in AgustaWestland money laundering case, to stay in CBI custody
content: James had sought release from custody on the grounds that he had completed the maximum sentence of 7 years in custody in the money laundering case

title: Congress stamps on the decision to go solo, Shiv Sena UBT says, will fight them too
content: Congress to prepare a charge sheet on the alleged corruption in BMC; Manifesto for the upcoming polls to be released soon

title: BJP government correcting mistakes Congress kept making in northeast for decades, says PM Modi in Assam
content: PM Narendra Modi was received at the Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport by Governor Laxman Prasad Acharya, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and his cabinet colleagues

title: The life and times of Sreenivasan: Cinema, satire and society
content: Sreenivasan, a celebrated figure in the Malayalam film industry, has profoundly influenced cinema and society through his sharp political satire and unforgettable characters. Renowned for his comic genius, the actor-scenarist-director has crafted iconic films. Here‚Äôs a collection of stories on the master satirist

title: Eggs safe for consumption; cancer risk claims unfounded: FSSAI
content: FSSAI has urged consumers to rely on verified scientific evidence and official advisories, reiterating that eggs remain a safe, nutritious and valuable component of a balanced diet when produced and consumed in compliance with food safety regulations

title: Nuclear Bill ‚Äòbulldozed‚Äô in Parliament to help PM Modi restore ‚ÄòSHANTI‚Äô with ‚Äòonce good friend‚Äô: Congress
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh had urged the government not to promote the private sector at the cost of the public sector in building nuclear power infrastructure

title: T.N. police warn public about new cyber scam involving USSD codes
content: Criminals impersonate courier or delivery service agents to fraudulently access citizens‚Äô bank accounts and social media profiles

title: Courts will lean toward animals who are silent victims of commercial ventures: Supreme Court
content: The Bench deferred the hearing on a batch of petitions filed by the owners of hotels and resorts in the Nilgiris to January, saying the issue required detailed consideration

title: 36 ex-judges slam Opposition move to impeach Justice Swaminathan
content: On December 1, Justice Swaminathan held that the Arulmighu Subramania Swamy Temple was duty-bound to light the lamp at the Deepathoon, in addition to the customary lighting near the Uchi Pillaiyar Mandapam

title: Snow, rain likely as Kashmir braces for 'Chillai-Kalan'
content: The local meteorological department has forecast a spell of wet weather on December 20-21, coinciding with the onset of 'Chillai-Kalan', which begins on December 21 every year and ends on January 31

title: Malayalis saw themselves, their emotions through Sreenivasan‚Äôs characters on screen, says Mohanlal
content: ‚ÄúWho else other than Sreenivasan can recreate the dreams and disillusionments of the middle class on screen?‚Äù said Mohanlal

title: Army jawan arrested for raping woman in Ranchi
content: The accused jawan is a resident of the Sarha police station area in Prayagraj district, Uttar Pradesh, and was posted with the 42 Medium Regiment in Punjab‚Äôs Patial

title: Sreenivasan needed just two films to cement his legacy as a director
content: The renowned actor and scenarist solidified his legacy in Malayalam cinema with just two influential films that he directed ‚Äì Vadakkunokkiyantram (1989) and Chinthavishtayaya Shyamala (1998) ‚Äì which garnered multiple awards between them, showcasing his unique blend of humour and social commentary

title: Kerala local body polls: BJP-led NDA‚Äôs footprint expands in Alappuzha district
content: NDA increases its ward tally to 240 from 181 in 2020 and registers gains in long-held Left strongholds such as Punnapra and Neelamperoor

title: Udupi-Chikkamagaluru MP Kota Srinivas Poojary demands greenfield expressway between Talapady in Dakshina Kannada and Karwar in Uttara Kannada
content: Raising the issue under Rule 377 in the Lok Sabha, the MP says existing four-lane Kochi-Panvel NH 66 has become highly congested resulting in accidents and fatalities

title: Kerala SIR: Citing inaccuracies in ASD list, political parties demand extension of SIR schedule
content: Demand comes on the heels of Supreme Court asking ECI to take a sympathetic view of representations seeking more time

title: World perceives India much more positively due to brand and talent, says Jaishankar
content: "No country, however powerful, can impose its will on all issues,‚Äù Mr. Jaishankar said, addressing the 22nd convocation of the Symbiosis International (Deemed University) in Pune

title: People need freedom from the mahajungle-raj in West Bengal, says PM Modi
content: Accusing the Trinamool Congress of protecting ‚Äò illegal infiltrators‚Äô, the Prime Minister said that Trinamool raises slogans of ‚ÄúGo Back Modi‚Äù but remains silent when it comes to ‚Äúillegal infiltrators‚Äù. ‚ÄúTrinamool Congress is opposing SIR to save infiltrators from getting identified,‚Äù Mr. Modi said

title: How South Asians became targets of racist hate on Elon Musk‚Äôs X | Explained
content: Racism and hate against South Asians on the basis of their skin colour, religious beliefs, careers in America, and migration history spread unchecked on Elon Musk‚Äôs X this year

title: Fire breaks out at BSNL office on Anna Salai in Chennai
content: Due to the fire, thick black smoke engulfed parts of the Anna Salai area, causing inconvenience to motorists; incident disrupts emergency services like city police control room (100) and ambulance (108) services

title: Malayalam film stalwart Sreenivasan‚Äôs legacy: A timeline
content: Malayalam film veteran Sreenivasan passed away due to ailments on December 20, 2025. Here is a look at his journey in film.

title: PM Modi to address first political rally in Bengal after draft roll release amid SIR concerns of Matuas

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, holiday gifts for each team
content: the Colorado Avalanche remain on top of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings . it's the holiday gifting season, which means what better time than now to hand out a gift to all 32 teams . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: 'OK, now tap your smiley face': How Kentucky's Eva Hudson is finding joy in the game
content: it's match point in the fifth set of the NCAA women's college volleyball semifinals between no.1 seed Kentucky and no. 3 seed Wisconsin . the Badgers blocked the shot out of bounds, but Hudson's power was too much for even the best defenders .

title: Premier League Future Power Rankings: Long-term projections for all 20 teams
content: clubs don't function in this way, or at least they shouldn't . they're signing players, developing talent, and acquiring coaches with a multi-year view into the future . if everyone only cared about this season, every player in the league would be 27 years-old .

title: First playoff Brawl of the Wild headlines FCS semifinal showdowns
content: a crowd of 27,340 watched Montana State play keep-away four weeks ago . the Grizzlies had just cut Montana State's lead to 31-28 with seven minutes remaining . but the visiting Bobcats moved the chains five times, including on fourth-and-1 and third-and-4 .

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: all-America hitter ava Underwood hoisted her in the air . the Aggies survived another marathon postseason set . they knocked off no. 1 seed Pittsburgh 29-27, 25-21, 25-20 in the final four .

title: Connelly on the CFP first round: Game-by-game previews
content: the first round of last year's inaugural 12-team college football playoff was memorable primarily for the otherworldly atmospheres . the four home teams were favored by an average of 8.8 points but won by 19.3 . we might get a couple of those this time around, too .

title: PM Modi's Bengal Address Decoded: Energising Cadre, Countering Mamata Banerjee
content: For the upcoming election in West Bengal, Prime Minister Narendra Modi remains the strongest brand equity for the state BJP in countering Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and her party, Trinamool Congress.

title: No Van To Pick Her Up, Schoolgirl Blocks Road In Protest For 3 Hours
content: On a quiet road in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district, traffic came to a standstill on Saturday as a 10-year-old girl blocked the road inprotest after her school van failed to arrive.

title: Christian Michel Gets Bail In Agusta Westland Money Laundering Case
content: The Rouse Avenue court on Saturday ordered to release Christian Michel James from custody in the alleged money laundering case linked with Augusta Westland chopper deal case.

title: ISRO Completes Drogue Parachute Tests For Gaganyaan Crew Module
content: ISRO has completed a series of qualification tests for Drogue Parachutes for the development of deceleration system of Gaganyaan Crew Module.

title: Rats Spotted in Newborn Care Unit of District Hospital In Madhya Pradesh
content: Days after a video showing rats roaming freely in the ICU and orthopedic ward of Jabalpur's Victoria Hospital triggered public outrage, a similar and deeply disturbing incident has now surfaced from Satna district in Madhya Pradesh.

title: "Mob Rule Should Not Prevail":  Shashi Tharoor Slams Violence In Bangladesh
content: Congress MP and Chairperson of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs, Shashi Tharoor, on Saturday strongly condemned the violence in Bangladesh.

title: Guwahati Gets India's First "Nature-Themed Airport"
content: The new terminal building of the Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport, inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, is the "country's first nature-themed airport."

title: PM Modi Defends Voter Roll Revision, Says Exercise Aims At Fair Polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday launched a sharp attack on the Congress, accusing the party of neglecting the development of the Northeast for decades, a failure he said had serious implications for national security.

title: How NDTV's 'Indian Of The Year' Madhavi Lata Helped Build World's Highest Rail Bridge
content: From a barefoot girl in a remote Andhra village who once sold old notebooks for 40 paise to buy kerosene to a celebrated scientist shaping India's engineering marvels - Professor Madhavi Latha's journey is nothing short of extraordinary.

title: Nearly 300 Families Stranded In This Delhi Locality After Sealing Drive By UP Body
content: On December 15, officials of the Uttar Pradesh Irrigation Department, accompanied by the Delhi Police, Uttar Pradesh Police, and paramilitary forces, conducted a large-scale sealing operation in Aali Gaon in Delhi.

title: Villagers To Hold Day-Long Fast To Protest Top Court's Aravalli Ruling
content: The #SaveAravalli movement has exploded across social media, trending nationwide and rallying thousands from rural communities, environmentalists to politicians.

title: Congress Leader Says Party To Contest Mumbai Civic Body Polls Independently
content: Congress party in charge of Maharashtra, Ramesh Chennithala, on Saturday announced that the party will contest the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections on its own strength.

title: 'His Blood Won't Go In Vain': Crowds At Funeral Of Bangladesh Leader
content: From dawn, groups of people arrived towards Manik Mia Avenue, quickly filling the area outside the Parliament complex. Many draped themselves in the national flag, while others shouted demands for accountability over Hadi's killing.

title: New Epstein Files Refer To "Massage Techniques", Ayurveda From India
content: The newly released Epstein files have references to what they described as "massage techniques" and Ayurveda from India.

title: 'Government Ran Bulldozer Over MGNREGA; Ready To Counter', Sonia Gandhi
content: Congress Parliamentary Party chairperson Sonia Gandhi on Saturday accused the Modi government of bulldozing the MGNREGA, and asserted that the "black law" that seeks to repeal it will be defied by the lakhs of party workers across the country.

title: Hindu Man Lynched In Bangladesh. Taslima Nasreen Shares A Sequence Of Events
content: A video being widely shared on social media shows Dipu Chandra Das, 25, in conversation with some men wearing what appears to be a police uniform shortly before he was lynched by a radical mob in Mymensingh, Bangladesh.

title: Opinion: Opinion | In 'Dhurandhar', More Gang Wars Than Spy Wars
content: It's a massacre at a grand wedding in Karachi, as two gangs, one led by a Baloch, another by a Pathan, turn their guns on each other.

title: Boy, 16, Thrashed With Plastic Pipe, Chilly Thrown In Eyes In Karnataka
content: A 16-year-old differently-abled boy was brutally thrashed at a residential school for special needs children in Navagar area in Bagalkot, a city in northern Karnataka, shows a disturbing video in a horrific case of abuse.

title: February 1 On Sunday, Confusion On Union Budget Presentation Date Continues
